distributional 0.3.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.0199145  9.8470308
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.054016 1.030676
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.3358512 0.2783542
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  1.56856390 -2.26677005  0.53497996  1.14071824  0.25187729  0.24217772
#>  [7]  1.37775495  0.97515694 -0.86547855  0.09707277
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 10.040490  9.759905  9.098321  9.362064 10.127511  9.600943  9.255425
#>  [8] 10.097141  7.951535 10.916986
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2234425 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.006434589 10.031298254
variance(dist)
#>             [,1]        [,2]
#> [1,]  0.92204838 -0.06435872
#> [2,] -0.06435872  0.87833193
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.001373447
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>             [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,]  0.2152032 10.452562
#>  [2,] -1.7534400 11.859185
#>  [3,]  0.0347510  9.185723
#>  [4,]  0.5901718 10.263337
#>  [5,] -0.5264068  9.973618
#>  [6,]  1.5547620 11.167823
#>  [7,] -0.2030024 10.074269
#>  [8,]  1.0664191  9.272634
#>  [9,]  1.6799536 10.084835
#> [10,] -0.6549418 10.694425
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2450582 0.0000000
